name: Golden Crown Paradise Resort Puerto Vallarta

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008
reviews.text: I continue to be surprised by the many positive reviews of this property. Overall it is only a small boutique hotel and quite boring...non-stop construction is going on to upgrade the 2nd floor restaurant and nearby cranes building a high rise condo are a constant pain. Really only one restaurant, Salvador's, so you will need to book most of your dinner reservations at the sister hotel, Crown Paradise. Positives: without a doubt...room service (best room service that I have seen for an A.I. hotel). No air conditioned bars, all are outdoor in the 90 degree + heat and 90 percent + humidity.
reviews.title: Good...Bad...Boring....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have always stayed at the Riu Hotels in Nuevo Vallarta and missed the big resort atmosphere...Golden is strictly a hotel and not a resort. The property is right next to the Marina, which is a positive if you are doing excursions and can you can take the local bus into downtown for only 50 cents.
reviews.title: Great place to relax and have fun!!

likes.liked: — Adult all-inclusive with a great location/view

reviews.title: Was So Sad to Leave!
reviews.text: Negatives: Boring, small, lack of options, construction noise, no tropical ambiance.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay at the Golden Crown. We arrived on Saturday, May 31st and departed June 6th. When first arriving at the airport we were bombarded by the timeshare people. One downside to the hotel is that we thought they could have done something to warn us about this predatory encounter. Nevertheless, unwarned we proceeded to play victim to the timeshare scheme. You will learn that these people come to you at the airport, make you believe that they are with your hotel and that they are helping you, and then they will turn around and invite you to see some other property for a discount on excursions. The silver lining is that we were advised these timeshare sellers must be out of the airport, the breeding ground for their scheme, in less than six months. However, we did in fact see one of the properties and we saved a lot of money on excursions because of it. If you fall victim to one of these sales pitches make sure you have an entire morning (and we mean AN ENTIRE MORNING) of your vacation you are willing to give up for it. We were NOT happy that we did. Again, we wished our hotel would have been there to protect us or at least to warn us.
reviews.title: Just as good as last time!!!

likes.liked: — The view, the service, the food and drinks!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once we arrived at the hotel, things got a whole lot better. We were greeted at the desk with a cold drink. We arrived about an hour before check in time so we got our wristbands (necessary for getting the benefits of the all-inclusive) and relaxed on the beach until our room was ready. Oscar (who always seemed to be on the beach) was there to serve us our first round of drinks. The drinks varied in strength but it did seem if you asked for stronger then you got it, just have to ask (and tip).
reviews.title: Excellent Vacation at the GCP Again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great place and totally restful vacation for two very busy medical people! my fiance and I needed a view, good food and drink and a very hospitable staff. When you book with GCP, ask for a room higher than floor #5 so you can fully enjoy the ocean. All rooms have terrific balconies and views. Take advantage of the room service, remember they serve "european portions" so order x2 if your appetite is robust! Spend sunsets at the Breeze Bar and you will never see more beautiful colors! Try the pork tacos by the pool, get yourself into the ocean at least once (water 86 degrees) and walk the quaint town. You will come home refreshed!!!
reviews.title: Great Destination for Relaxation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I have just returned from a 2 week stay at the Golden Crown Paradise Puerto Vallarta.
reviews.title: loved it

likes.disliked: — being allocated a room on the ground floor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were attentive and nothing was too much trouble for them.
reviews.title: A great place!

likes.liked: — The service,the cleanliness, the relaxed atmosphere,the company
likes.disliked: — Being initially placed in room 1104. Be aware that room floods during a heavy downpour,due to water cascading down a set of stairs leading to the second floor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were greeted with a refreshing fruit drink and cool face towel. We were originally allocated a room on the ground floor opposite the bar however they were more than happy to relocate us when we asked and ended up on the 2nd floor with a lovely sea view. All 1st floor rooms are probably not the best as you don't get such a good view.
reviews.title: Another great vacation!

likes.disliked: — Please, for your employees sanity, change the CD in the Breeze Bar! I was there for a week and I know every song!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Adults only concept was one we loved - no screaming kids
reviews.title: Fun for couples, not so much singles...
Do not go
reviews.text: check in was ok. rooms were outdated with floral pastel comforters. tennis court with red mud. alcohol was watered down. food was not fresh. rubbery texture to meat. dirty beach. makes you want to stay away from puerto vallarta.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend, myself and a friend stayed here from November 17th to December 1st, We are all in our mid 20's.
reviews.title: Didn't live up to reviews.

likes.liked: — Service, Room View, Sunsets, Listening to people who have had one to many drinks.
likes.disliked: — Beds, we like hard beds, but they were just uncomfterable. Food, Ants,

reviews.title: overall good
reviews.text: Rooms-

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were all on the 6th floor, My girlfriend and I 3 rooms from the ocean front, our friend 10 rooms back, I would reccommend requesting a room on this floor or higher and close to the ocean, as we had a nicer view in our room then our friend did. The rooms all had a bad smell when left closed, this was fixed by leaving the window open or burning a scented candle we brought from home. Paint is cracked in corners, and there are lots of small ants, could use some renovations but our vacation was not effected by this.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Beach/Pool-
reviews.title: Decent Deal for the Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here in April 2008, overall the hotel was good. It was clean, the pool was nice and the staff was friendly and helpful. I agree with the positive reviews given to this hotel by everyone else.
reviews.title: Pretty Good Hotel
It was great
reviews.text: A few things to know:

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -The food was average, snacks and lunch food was good, the dinners left something to be desired so we went out a few nights, but what can you expect for all inclusive. If you order breakfast room service, make sure you do so the night before.
reviews.title: Great choice for our honeymoon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -They had entertainment and music each night, if you go to bed early get a room away from the courtyard so you do not hear the music playing till midnight.
reviews.title: Great Resort. Horrendous Music.

likes.disliked: — Loud music and noise in hallways early in the morning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Location is good. A cab ride into town only took a few minutes and was 50 pesos. We did not venture on public transportation.
reviews.title: Frends for life

likes.disliked: — did away with breakfast at the pardise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved our stay at the Golden Crown. Golden Crown caters to younger travelers who leave the kids at home. Definitely not the senior citizen crowd.
reviews.title: great place no kids

likes.disliked: — tried to talk me into a 90 minute presentation which I had no interest in

reviews.title: Great Time at the Golden Crown Paradise
reviews.text: Rooms: nice sized rooms much like the one bedroom apartment I lived in college. All rooms have balconies with a view of the ocean and pool.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food: All restaurants are a la carte, no buffet in sight. Pool side tacos, burgers and pizza for lunch. The food at Salvadors was great. We had no problem getting reservations for the evening. Make sure you get the "Sexy Coffee" after dinner. The presentation is impressive and the coffee delicious. Also, take advantage of the morning breakfast room service the Golden offers - very convenient and delivered on time. Also for Sushi eaters, the Breeze Bar has sushi after 6 p.m. that you can help yourself to.
reviews.title: Will return for sure!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Drinks: Its all inclusive, need I say more. The Golden serves Sol and Indio beer. Indio is only available in Mexico and can't be found at all the Mexican resorts.
reviews.title: Average all inclusive

likes.liked: — Great Ocean Views from the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Activities: pool volley ball, beach volley ball and pool aerobics are all part of the fun of staying at an all inclusive and enjoying your stay. Take advantage of the Spa. I got a great massage there.
reviews.title: We were planning our next trip in the cab to the airport...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at GCP July 6 - July 14
reviews.title: Would definitely stay at GCP again

likes.liked: — The facilities were wll laid out and had beautiful views of the bay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Just read the review that was pretty negative about GCP and it surprises me how it can be SO different from one review to the next.
reviews.title: Be forewarned....if you are not 22 this place is not for you!

likes.disliked: — The rooms, lack of decent amenities in rooms, bad food, cheap bad liquor, geared for spring breakers only.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at the GCP could not have been better. Check in was smooth, the room was great, the food was very good at all of the restaurants with the exception of the Japanese cuisine at the next door family property ( food was ok but nothing outstanding). Of course there are vendors on the beach and they are trying to make a buck but a simple "No thank you" worked just fine.
reviews.title: Don't Go to GCP...dirty, rude staff, dirty cups, mold, ants, very bad food!

likes.liked: — The only thing I liked was the city of Puerto Vallarta, Mexico....nothing about the GCP!
likes.disliked: — Everything! Dirty room, sewer smell in the bathroom, our ceiling flooding, mold, rude staff, dirty cups, very bad food, and also all the rules that GCP has!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Many of the reviews have comments on the firmness of the beds and I would agree they are a little hard, go with the flow, have a little more tequila and by night 3 the bed will be just fine
reviews.title: The Golden Crown paradise is different than the Crown Paradise
Good Hotel
reviews.text: We did not drink the water at the hotel but opted to do the Wal-Mart thing (which seemed a bit surreal)..bought water and brought back to the hotel. Even though water maybe purified in Puerto Vallarta it still travels through old and decrepit pipe systems and we did not want to risk getting ill. As a side note and I am sure it has been mentioned before...travelers should start taking a couple Pepto tablets every day for 3-4 days before they travel and that generally will prevent any water related bacteria from causing any problems!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My best friend decided to celebrate her birthday with a trip to Mexico and we choose the Golden Crown Paradise based on reviews. Also, everyone was a on a different budget, so all inclusive seemed to be the best way to go. Drinks, food, beach, your girlfriends in one place - what can be beat?
reviews.title: Not Bad - Still Had Fun

likes.liked: — Most of the staff, ease of getting drinks & food
likes.disliked: — Lack of follow up on reservations, missing towels, hard beds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reservations were fairly simple. We'd seen prices of $200+ online so my best friend emailed the hotel directly. We got a great price by doing this. They did charge my friend for the first night for each person as a deposit. About 3 weeks before we left, we saw a bunch of ads online advertising the Golden Crown for like $110 a night. Even though we did get a deal, a sale is a sale. We immediately contacted the place again to see what they could do for us. A week goes by and no response to email. We try again and wait a few days. Nothing. Finally, we get one of our spanish speaking friends to call the hotel and find out about the deal. The hotel says they will have to cancel and rebook the whole trip and recharge the first night on my best friends card AND they didn't know when she'd get her credit. Needless to say, we didn't get the discount after hearing that. I did think "Ok, it's Mexico, the technology is different, you're still going to have fun." But it did feel kind of shady at this point.
reviews.title: I would look elsewhere

likes.disliked: — The bed, the pool, the food, the street peddlers.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A week and a half later we all make it to Mexico and are able to check in quickly. All the girls arrived at different times and we were last. Check in was pretty smooth, but after my roomie and I were like "Wait, they're charging for the remote, safe key, and what else?" (In case of loss of course) We had to laugh. It was all said so fast!
reviews.title: A Great All Inclusive Adult Resort

likes.liked: — The View and Poly's Sexy Coffee!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we first walked into our room, we loved it. No it's not 5 star Ritz Carlton, but it was still nice! We had an ocean view and were stuck on the 2nd floor. At first we were bummed, but as we relaxed on the patio after our journey we thought it was great. We were right above the pool, so we could talk to the other girls when they were down there. Again, we could still see the ocean, so it was all good. The beds were amazingly hard. My second night there I could NOT sleep to save my life and I was amazingly drunk. I should have passed out immediately.
reviews.title: Trip Report, Golden Crown Paradise

likes.disliked: — No mini-bar/fridge in room; smaller pool with crowded set-up

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The restaurants are ok. I loved the tacos at the poolside bar and Salvadors. The rest, eh. Typically mass produced food, kinda like wedding food. The midnight snacks are pretty good and my friends were always ordering room service, just because. They loved it. The wait staff was ok the first night and got better the more we tipped. Not that I'm surprised, but just putting it out there. My girl friend says she remembers reading somewhere on the property literature that you did not have to tip as tip was included in the all inclusive price. Not sure if this is true, but we tipped anyway.
reviews.title: Fantastic Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I've heard some mixed revues about this resort, and was a little aprehensive before going...... Don't always go on what other's say obviously. If you've never been to Mexico before please understand that it is not AMERICA. Things are different, you will be treated different, no the beds aren't as soft, yeah the food may not be as good, but that's what's sometimes exciting! I had never been to PV before but had stayed at all inclusive resorts in Mexico. Once we got to know the employees, we were "golden" they're all so nice, they knew us by name (it's all about how you treat other's) The food at the resturant's was good, but to be honest we spent most our time at the pool or bar so ate at the snack bar. The taco bar is great, their breakfasts at the hut bar are great, but I would advise againsnt the room service breakfast. Room service otherwise was great, I ordered beer and shots to my room at all hours of the night. They got to know me by name and knew exactly what I wanted once I told them my room number. hehe..... Like most I think you go to Mexico to have a good time and drink! Well I was able to do plenty of that. My girlfriend and I wanted to rest on the beach till all hours one night, they made sure they came and checked on us to make sure we were okay, and safe. They're very worried and care a lot about your safety. Puerto Vallarta is VERY GAY FRIENDLY so if that's an issue for you, don't hang out downtown in the clubs. My best friend who joined me is gay but I am not, however I of course AM gay friendly, so I had a fantastic time downtown which we hung out all night. Sorry getting off track here. Our room was AMAZING!!! we had a fantastic view right over the ocean, I loved the pool, once you get to know the bartenders and waitstaff they'll take very good care of you. If you treat them like servants they're not going to be as attentive to you, which is in my opionion expected. So go, have an open mind, don't be easily discouraged, you're still in a foreign country, I've yet to stay at ANY hotel in the world that had a soft comfortable bed. And I've been all over the world. You shouldn't worry much about that anyway, you're not there to stay in the room, you're there to have fun! DO SO! Thanks!
reviews.title: Fantabulous!!!

likes.liked: — All Adult, no spring breaker's or kids running around! Everything was great! no complaints!
likes.disliked: — I don't think I could think of one bad thing to say about this place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed at GCP from July 22nd through 25th, after reading some of the bad reviews posted, I begin to wonder if they’re writing about the same resort. As an Airline crew member who has traveled for 20 years, stayed at over 7000 plus hotels, I think I’ve earn a little rights to submit a fare review.
reviews.title: Attentions to details.
Just got back from Golden Crown Paradise
reviews.text: For starters, most Mexico hotels / resorts, has a check in time of 3:00pm sometimes 4:00 pm, even at US or Europe, most hotels have the same policy. If you arrived at GCP early, GCP offers a Hospitality suite for you to change and refresh till your room is ready, the hospitality suite consists of Sectional sofa, TV, full bathroom for his and hers with showers. The Front desk staff makes every effort to accommodate you, regarding taking care of most of the paper work for check in. Information of resort amenities. Getting you set up with the wrist band, so you can start to enjoy the resort before your room is ready.

reviews.title: A Wonderful Trip
reviews.text: Unlike the newer hotels at the Nuevo Vallarta, most of the old Puerto Vallarta’s hotels are a least 25 years or older, however this property is full of caractors, the adults only policy makes such relax atmosphere and their attention to details (such as cold towel upon arrival, Mei Tai’s when checking in, just to name a few), really makes up for the lack of that larger, grand feeling from some of the newer hotels.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were adequate, Clean, comes with all the necessary trimmings, TV, Coffee maker (even though you won’t needed with the 24 hrs room service), Iron and board, cold AC, big Bathtub, Safety deposit box (get your own set of key and lock from the front desk), all rooms has Ocean or partial Ocean view balcony, the Maids typically leaves 2 small bottled water on the counter, however when I ask for more, they gave me as many as needed. You may also purchase large bottled water at the gift shop for $2 each.
reviews.title: Room with a view, great food, burning rash

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006
reviews.text: We stayed at the GCP July 8th-July 13th, 2006. Had an uneventful trip on American Airlines. We even arrived early.
reviews.title: Good times!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: Upon our arrival we were greeted with a cold wash cloth and a drink. Check-in went smoothly. The staff was friendly and helpful. We had a honeymoon suite which was not ready yet, so the staff told us to walk around and enjoy ourselves. They have a hospitality room that guests can use to change into their pool attire.
reviews.title: GCP Again #12
Pretty dang good
reviews.text: A little before 3:00 pm the room was ready. The bellboy grabbed our luggage and took us to our room. It was our anniversary. The staff had left a nice card in the room along with a bottle of champagne. The room was nice and clean. It had a jacuzzi tub in the room. It had a great view of the ocean.

reviews.title: Not What You Would Expect From a 4 Star Hotel
reviews.text: Housekeeping always did a great job with the room. We never had a problem with not having towels or making up the room late. They did a wonderful job.

reviews.title: What a Dump
reviews.text: We thought the resort was clean and well kept. The staff was always cleaning and mowing the area. The bar staff was quick about cleaning up the plates and glasses around the pool.

reviews.title: Best Vacation in Many Years!
reviews.text: Puerto Vallarta. Go there if you want to REALLY see the relaxing side of Mexico! The REAL Mexico! That's what we were told. So we booked it. What did I know. We've been to Cabo, Cancun, Cozumel, and other places along the east and west coast. This WAS the best... ...by far. The Golden Crown Paridise Resort was a fine all-inclusive, all-adult resort with really nice rooms, great views and a WONDERFUL STAFF! The food was great and the varity of menues choices and 3 restaurants and a snack bar was terrrific. The menues change daily at each. I cannot say enough about the friendly, efficient staff. From behind the scenes cusdodians to the front desk, and everybody in between. They were all super friendly, very outgoing and couldn't be more helpful. Always a biig smile and an "HOLA!" for you wherever you went. You just couldn't help being in a great mood all the time. I'd like to give a special "gracias!" to Victor and Ramirez. The 2 Pool side bartenders that made our week. Never saw 2 guys that worked so hard and smiled so much all the time. They really loved what they do and it showed! I'll be honest, I love kids, but this is the first time in years I've been a pool. It was nice to be in a pool without the shrill squeels and shreeks of the chrildren and the splashing as well as the parent/child banter that usually accompanies those poolside activities. Nice place + Good food + Great Staff + Friendly atmosphere = The best vacation in many, many years!

reviews.title: travel
reviews.text: Stayed at the Crown Paradise Resort in Puerto Vallarta, Mexicao July 22nd,2006. Property was clean, staff helpful, and food was average. Tha al la carte restaurants were excellent. Make the reservations. Our only disappointment was we were unable to snorkle in that area due to the water being unclear. We used public transport, busses to go all over without a problem. Cost us 80 cents to take bus to the Mismaloya area and $24.00 to water taxi out to a secluded beach area where we were dropped off to snorkle and they picked us up 4 hrs later. Perfect. Ask around. This compared to $140.00 for 2 hrs. through the travel agency. Watched the surfers at the opposite end another day. Enjoyed our visit.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Golden Crown Paradise for the second straight year June 9th-19th, 2006. This visit was just as and maybe even more special than our first. The staff at the GCP went out of their way to make us feel a part of the family and even added some special touches for us as returning guests.
reviews.title: GCP - Our new Home away from Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: Upon our arrival, we were given an invitation to the "Returner's Dinner" that night at sunset on the beach in front of the resort. A large table was setup right next to the Breeze Bar. It was a wonderful setting having dinner with the other returning guests there at the time. We had our pictures taken as a group at sunset. We were really taken care of and the service was even more attentive than the great service that we received on a regular basis in both the Paradise Restaurant and Salvador's on site. My wine glass was always full and we met some very nice people at the same time. The dinner was so good, that one week later, when invited to attend the dinner again, we decided to show up and enjoy the ambiance once more.
reviews.title: We had the best time ever!
Great Time at the Golden Paradise
reviews.text: In addition the the "Returner's Dinner" we were given a letter from management welcoming us back to the resort. We were also given a nameplate underneath our room number showing our room as "Casa Alexander." Additionally we were given a welcome from housekeeping who spelled out Welcome using flower petals with a towel in the form of a swan on the bed. These warm touches made our return visit special and we know that the GCP does truly care about getting repeat business.

reviews.title: Love it!
reviews.text: Great place to stay. Guests are mainly people in their 30s and up. The hotel is clean, the staff is friendly, and the food was good.

reviews.title: Outdated but great Staff
reviews.text: The all inclusive option allows you to eat dinner at any of the 5 restaurants in the resort and sister resort (two nights at the French, Japanese or Italian and as many times in the other two restaurants). Room Service menu needs improvement and the service itself needs was poor. The grill by the pool does not offer as much of a variety as the web site shows in the images of the hotel. They only served their Mexican tacos, wings, pizza, burgers and hot dogs. No the place for run of the mill food, as they lack flavor.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dinner menu include 5 course meals: appetizer, salad, soup, main course and desert. Gourmet portions are served. The menu selections on any given day, offer you beef, chicken, pork, lamb, fish or pasta. I did not have pasta.
reviews.title: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay

likes.disliked: — No place to sit in the room comfortably other than the bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lunch and breakfast options were good, changing daily, so you can try different things.
reviews.title: Enjoyable Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My room was nice and clean, with a bit of mildew smell if the A/C was turned off.
reviews.title: Worst experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: This was our 3rd stay at GCP and was more special then ever as we were celebrating my dad's birthday. While there, we met up with Ron who has been there 37 times I believe and to top it off it was his birthday too. Trust me when I say, the staff made it known it was their birthday.
reviews.title: This is our 3rd visit, if you have stayed before please read....

likes.disliked: — That the breakfast buffet is no longer available and Aldo is no longer at the pool.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet is no longer available at "Paradise" and Poly is no longer upstairs. He is now a waiter at the new Mexican restaraunt next to the Belavista Cafe by the pool bar. Aldo is no longer by the pool, he is upstairs at Paradise in the evenings now. Like Poly and Paradise, and Aldo at the pool bar, they both were one of the reasons for our return visits as they made the atmosphere that much more enjoyable.
reviews.title: Muy Bonita!!!!!! A must see!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008
reviews.text: If you have been a frequent visitor at Golden Crown and enjoyed Poly at Paradise and Aldo at the pool bar as much as our group does, please email the hotel directly and request they return to the places they love. Other than that, our trip was wonderful as usual. If you have any questions please feel free to ask.
reviews.title: The Good and the Bad........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I wanted one last vacation before we started to have babies, so we wanted a relaxing, stress free last indulgance for just "us" ecspecially after this long cold Wisconsin winter we just had. I cannot be more pleased with this resort. This was the best vacation that we ever took. We have been on alot of cruises and always thought that was the way to travel, but we have found our new place to return too. Its the Golden Crown, with its warm welcoming "hot towels and refreshing beverages" upon arrival to its "sexy coffee" after dinner drink, we could not be happier. I HIGHLY reccomend this resort. Ultra Romantic, quiet, CLEAN, peaceful, staff is super friendly and we met some great people from around the states. The pool bar is the place to be after dinner, with its pool table and cute little bar. The food is amazing, Mahi Mahi is to die for. We loved every second and maybe we need just one more visit here before we have babies?? :) Otherwise we can take them to the kid friendly Crown right next door. All in all this vacation was PERFECT. I love Mexcio and while the gulf side is a bit more crazy with its party life, this was the perfect vacation for us "older more mature" partyers that like to enjoy the next day laying by the pool and realxing in the sun, not hungover and sick. The music the people the food was great. The staff could not be more helpful, these people work their butts off, often working all day at the pool bar and then all night at the club and then repeat it over and over. They always have a smile on thier face and will do anything to make your stay enjoyable. In conclusion, we highly reccomend this resort, for the price was super affordable (all inclusive, meals and premium drinks for us drinkers here in Wisconsin!!) Great wine with dinner, and GOOD drinks with GOOD liquor, not rail stuff that makes you sick. We truly were not ready to go back, We were actually very sad to say goodbye, I'm still sad!! But we have so many great memories. And like one staff member said to us upon leaving, "you have to go home to actually miss us and then come back, it cant be paradise everyday cuz you wont know what your missing"!! So only 301 days till we come back!!! We will be back, over and over and over!!!!!
reviews.title: Not a 5* hotel

likes.disliked: — Quality of food nad overall service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Folks, I have relied on Trip Advisor heavily over the past few years for picking my hotels, so I thought I would give something back and write a review of my experiences.
reviews.title: Quality dropped a bit

likes.liked: — Very good food and top shelf drinks

aka: Golden Crown Paradise Resort Puerto Vallarta Hotel
description: Golden Crown Paradise All Inclusive Resort where our unmatched personalized and friendly service are a cut above the rest with a great location just 10 minutes from downtown and 15 minutes from the International Airport. As an adults-only all-inclusive resort, our focus is on pampering, tranquility, and rejuvenation.
